li.a: White Bear Lake Area Educational Foundation

img.alt: female student smiling and point at white board to a word that is in french
female teacher smiling sitting on blanket she made with 4 female students around her
bear costume giving thumbs up next to a carrot costumed person
Students holding banner at Homecoming parade
Student smiling at the camera while working with tires
Four students dressed in and learning about Hmong clothing
A group of students smiling at the camera at the WBLAHS Graduation Ceremony

div.h2:
Welcome to
White Bear Lake Area Schools

div.p: The community at the forefront of educational excellence, honoring our legacy and courageously building the future, White Bear Lake Area Schools serves all or parts of Birchwood, Gem Lake, Hugo, Lino Lakes, Little Canada, Maplewood, North Oaks, Vadnais Heights, White Bear Lake and White Bear Township.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsSlideshow fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_15 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.title: Distance Learning Period Extended Through School Year

img.alt: Distance Learning Period Extended Through School Year

div.a: Distance Learning Period extended through school year

div.p: Governor Walz announced today, April 23, that the Distance Learning Period will be extended for all Minnesota schools through the end of the 2019-20 academic year due to the novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) health crisis.

div.a: Brian Morris named Hugo Elementary Principal

div.p: The White Bear Lake Area School District is pleased to announce that Brian Morris has been chosen to serve as the districts Hugo Elementary Principal, a role he stepped into as an interim appointment earlier this school year.

div.a: Darcy Rodriguez named Early Childhood Coordinator

div.p: The White Bear Lake Area School District is pleased to announce that Darcy Rodriguez has been chosen to serve as the districts Early Childhood Coordinator, a position that was vacated when Kate Andersen left the position to serve as a Director of Community Education in another school district.

div.a: Dr. Marcellus Davis named Director of Equity and Engagement

div.p: The White Bear Lake Area School District is pleased to announce that Dr. Marcellus Davis has been chosen to serve as the districts Director of Equity and Engagement.

In these days of social distancing community engagement via window dressings, we invite you to join the fun in creating a White Bear Window for friends and neighbors to enjoy from afar while they walk the neighborhood.

div.title: istance Learning to be implemented March 30 to May 4

img.alt: istance Learning to be implemented March 30 to May 4

div.a: Distance Learning March 30 to May 4, childcare info

div.p: The Governor announced today that all Minnesota school districts must implement a Distance Learning Period from March 30 to May 4. Until we can see each other in person again, hopefully on May 5, we are excited to connect remotely.

p.strong: PLEASE NOTE - This update is no longer current. Please find the most current Distance Learning update here.

div.title: Building Our Future Facilities Process Update slide

img.alt: Building Our Future Facilities Process Update slide

div.a: Building Our Future Facilities Process Update

div.p: In lieu of the in-person Community Listening Sessions that were scheduled for this spring, we have created apresentationto explain the participatory process being used for each design in our Facilities Planning Process that will be phased in through 2025.
Find important updates including meal access information, answers to frequently asked questions and resources for families.

White Bear Lake Area Schools and programs will remain closed through Friday, March 27, following Governor Walzs direction in closing all schools and instruction in the state for the next two weeks. Instruction is expected to begin again state-wide on Monday, March 30, potentially through distance learning in our district. Learn more.

p.strong: PLEASE NOTE - This update is no longer current. Please find the most current Distance Learning update here.

div.p: The Support Hub is a new resource available on the districts website to provide families with necessary information to address barriers and enhance well-being. This support gives families and community members access to information for essential services including crisis response, basic needs, mental health and well-being, physical health, social emotional learning and more.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-3 fsTag-5 fsTag-7 fsTag-15 fsTag-16 fsTag-19

div.p: There is anelectronic formto report concerns regarding a student's well-being: mental health, chemical use, social isolation, bullying, harassment, etc.

div.title: Extended Spring Break for students picture

img.alt: Extended Spring Break for students picture

div.a: Extended Spring Break for students March 16-17

p.strong: PLEASE NOTE - This update is no longer current. Please find the most current Distance Learning update here.

div.p: We are sorry to report that our district continues to be one of many who are experiencing a service outage of FeePay (our online payment provider).We will provide email updates to families as we work through the issues with the FeePay online payment system.
The district is currently accepting kindergarten enrollmentsfor the 2020-21 school year. Find additional information at www.isd624.org/kindergarten.

Some changesin the registration systems will impact how families and community members pay for meals, fees, and activities (through FeePay) and/or register for Community Education programs (through Eleyo).

Mental Well-Being Series Presentation (All-District Event) @ DC
District-Wide AVID Celebration and Graduation @ WBLAHS - South Campus Theater

a.span: 4855 Bloom Avenue, White Bear Lake, MN 55110

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Distance Learning Period extended through school year

div.p:
Governor Walz announced today, April 23, that the Distance Learning Period will be extended for all Minnesota schools through the end of the 2019-20 academic year due to the novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) health crisis.
We know the governors Executive Order 20-41 to close school for the rest of the school year presents a challenge to our families. Our district has been anticipating this possibility all along and will continue to work diligently to partner with you in furthering your childs education and well-being. Find more information on the district's website. Oprime aqu para informacin en espaol.
